result.execSummary:
All charges against Essence Imani Mire in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Essence Imani Mire is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Essence Imani Mire

records.addlTxt: 8:52 AM Defendant Essence Imani Mire not in court.  Attorney Kevin M Smith in court for Essence Imani Mire.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders case dismissed on the motion of the State.

8:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Richard Jay Sullivan in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Essence Imani Mire appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kevin M Smith in court for Essence Imani Mire. State to notify Texas that Defendant is ready for pick up.
Review hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing on July 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.

01:15 PM Defendant Essence Imani Mire in court by video means, in custody at the Rock County Jail and with attorney Kevin M Smith in person.  David Zarwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person.  Review hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Activity: Extradition hearing
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

11:46 AM Defendant Essence Imani Mire in court, by video means, in custody at the Rock County Jail and with attorney Kevin M Smith in person.  David Zarwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person. Defendant waives extradition; Court accepts waiver. Court orders bond revoked.  Review hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Extradition hearing on April 20, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:03 PM Defendant Essence Imani Mire in court in custody at the Rock County Jail by video with attorney Kevin M Smith by video. Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Cash bond set of $10,000.00 with conditions. Remand to branch 6 for scheduling.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
